doc.title: ![Figure 0-0](images/0_0.jpg)
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-29/EM FX Daily Report - 29th August 2025EM FX Daily Report - 29th August 2025_2025-08-29

passages.text: Very little to report for most of the day with spot trading sporadically between 80.25 and 80.40. There was however, a little move lower down to 80.00 in the last couple of hours or so, with location driving the move. We are, if anything, seeing better corporate right hand side flow in NDFs, but it's being comfortably absorbed by the onshore selling. Still holding a modest usd short, picking up 3- 4 kopeck carry per day.

Disappointing price action in USDZAR, despite the dollar offer yesterday and USDCNH under pressure, USDZAR was unable to sustain any move lower and finds itself back above 17.70 this AM. I hold a small short after selling towards 17.75, but can't say I am feeling too enthused. Perhaps we need to get month end out the way, but am conscious that whilst dollar shorts makes sense, any turn in risk (i.e. off Fed independence), would see me cut. Flow wise we saw some RM ZAR demand however systematics selling rand for the second consecutive day.

State banks adjusted their offers by 950 pips to 41.1500 overnight deviating from the usual 750 pips on Fridays. It must be noted that this was a 4 day roll instead of the regular 3- day roll, which may partially account for the larger adjustment. Monitoring the adjustments early next week will be crucial to reassess our assumptions regarding the pace of nominal depreciation, which explains the option related outflows this morning, though volumes traded at state bank offers remain limited (approx \(\) 300\(mio). Following the round trip after the Jackson Hole, the broad dollar seems to be in consolidation mode, but we maintain a preference for weaker USD ahead of the US NFP next week. Meanwhile, we continue to run long TRY positions while keeping an eye on the adjustments next week. We still think that CBT's focus on real TRY appreciation should remain an anchor for the long TRY view and continue to perform in absence of any meaningful political risk events until the CHP court case on 15 September.

The broad dollar is in consolidation mode with month- end flows dominating this week, while we generally have a preference for weaker dollar. In Ce3, we still have a preference for HUF and CZK over PLN given Poland's widening CA deficit as well as its large fiscal deficit which warrants a higher risk premium for PLN compared to its peers.

Not really much to add here in EURHUF, chopping around a tighter 396.50/397.50 range. Whilst there are positives for HUF (hawkish NBH, carry, ToTs, lower gas), these are not really new stories and so struggle to see what takes EURHUF below the recent range. The other tailwind of Russia/Ukraine also continues to distance, with Merz saying a Zelensky/Putin meet is unlikely. All this being said, still happy to hold a core EURHUF short whilst vol is low, at least to earn some carry.

EURCE3 remains mostly directionless ever since optimism surrounding fresh Russia/Ukraine diplomatic efforts faded. Over the medium term, however, CZK should continue to perform well given the strong domestic fundamentals, the latest being this morning's strong GDP print – stay short EURCZK.
Cross a fair degree higher from 5.0575 to 5.0675. Didn't see the flows here but can only speculate that it was probably corporate right hand side.
Shekel still performing really well even if the move has slowed down a little. Spot now around 3.3250/75. Don't expect much action today on a Friday ahead of a long weekend in the U.S.

Usd/KZT seems to have found a bit of a short- term range (537- 540). Just about worth holding a small carry exposure for those with a good helping of patience. Rate decision at 8 a.m today. Tough to call with inflation stubbornly high and the currency weak on one hand, but with most other Central Banks (the CBR most notably) cutting rates now. Certainly a small hike will help tense, even if it's only a short term reaction.
